requirement_summary: Obligations of manufacturers - security by design
description: Documented cybersecurity risk assessment covering the planning, design, development, production, delivery and maintenance phases of the product with digital elements, including analysis based on intended purpose, foreseeable use, and operational environment
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Show me the documented cybersecurity risk assessment for this product with digital elements
How did you determine which essential cybersecurity requirements from Annex I apply to your product?
How do you ensure due diligence when integrating third-party components, including open-source software?
What is the defined support period for this product and how was it determined?

maturity_levels.basic: Risk assessment document exists covering intended purpose and foreseeable use
maturity_levels.intermediate: Risk assessment updated throughout product lifecycle, third-party component risks tracked, support period justified with market analysis
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous risk assessment integrated into CI/CD pipeline, automated dependency scanning, predictive vulnerability modelling

description: Documented policies and procedures for handling vulnerabilities throughout the support period, including coordinated vulnerability disclosure policy as required by Annex I Part II, point (5), and processes for security updates
auditor_questions: Show me your coordinated vulnerability disclosure policy and the single point of contact for users
How do you handle vulnerabilities reported from internal and external sources?
How do you ensure security updates remain available for at least 10 years after issuance?
When you identify a vulnerability in an integrated open-source component, how do you report it upstream?

maturity_levels.basic: Vulnerability handling policy exists with designated contact point
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured disclosure process, automated patch distribution, upstream reporting for open-source components
maturity_levels.advanced: Bug bounty programme, automated vulnerability triage, machine-readable SBOM-linked vulnerability tracking

requirement_summary: Reporting actively exploited vulnerabilities and severe incidents
description: Log of all notifications submitted to CSIRT and ENISA via the single reporting platform, including early warnings within 24 hours, vulnerability notifications within 72 hours, and final reports within 14 days of corrective measures
auditor_questions: Show me all actively exploited vulnerability notifications submitted to your CSIRT coordinator in the past year
For this vulnerability, demonstrate that the early warning was submitted within 24 hours of becoming aware
How do you inform impacted users of actively exploited vulnerabilities and severe incidents?
Show me the final report for this incident including severity description, malicious actor information, and corrective measures

maturity_levels.basic: Notifications submitted within required timelines via single reporting platform
maturity_levels.intermediate: Automated timeline tracking, structured user notification process, templates for early warning and final reports
maturity_levels.advanced: Integrated CSIRT reporting pipeline, automated severity classification, real-time user notification system with machine-readable format

description: Machine-readable software bill of materials documenting all components, including open-source dependencies, as required by Annex I Part II point (1), identifying at minimum the top-level dependencies of the product
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Provide the SBOM for this product in a machine-readable format
How do you track and update the SBOM when components change?
How do you monitor known vulnerabilities in listed components?
Can you demonstrate how the SBOM was used to assess dependency risk during the last vulnerability incident?

maturity_levels.intermediate: SBOM includes transitive dependencies, generated automatically during build, linked to vulnerability databases
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time SBOM updates in CI/CD pipeline, automated CVE correlation, dependency risk scoring

description: Complete technical documentation as specified in Annex VII, containing all relevant data on the means used to ensure the product and manufacturer processes comply with essential cybersecurity requirements, drawn up before market placement and continuously updated
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Show me the complete technical documentation as required by Annex VII for this product
How is the technical documentation kept up to date during the support period?
Where essential cybersecurity requirements are not applicable, show me the justification in the documentation
Is the technical documentation available in an official language of the Member State where the notified body is established?

maturity_levels.basic: Technical documentation exists covering all Annex VII elements
maturity_levels.intermediate: Documentation version-controlled, regularly updated, includes clear non-applicability justifications
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated documentation generation from development tools, linked to SBOM and risk assessment, continuous compliance validation

description: Evidence of conformity assessment performed using one of the procedures in Annex VIII: internal control (Module A), EU-type examination (Module B) with internal production control (Module C), full quality assurance (Module H), or European cybersecurity certification scheme
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Which conformity assessment procedure did you apply and why?
For important products class I or II, show evidence that the appropriate third-party assessment was performed
If harmonised standards were not applied, show how you met the assessment requirements for important products
Show me the notified body certificate or European cybersecurity certification where applicable

maturity_levels.basic: Conformity assessment completed using appropriate Module for product class
maturity_levels.intermediate: Assessment integrated into product development lifecycle, notified body engaged early for important products
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous conformity validation, European cybersecurity certification scheme used where available, automated compliance checks

description: EU declaration of conformity drawn up in accordance with Annex V model structure, stating that fulfilment of applicable essential cybersecurity requirements has been demonstrated, available in required languages of the Member State where the product is placed on the market
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Show me the EU declaration of conformity for this product
Does the declaration follow the Annex V model structure and contain all required elements?
Is the declaration available in the languages required by the target Member States?
Where the product is subject to multiple EU legal acts, show me the single combined declaration

maturity_levels.basic: Declaration exists following Annex V structure, available in required languages
maturity_levels.intermediate: Declaration management system in place, multi-regulation declarations consolidated, regular reviews for accuracy
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated declaration generation linked to conformity assessment results, real-time compliance monitoring

description: Evidence that CE marking is affixed visibly, legibly and indelibly to the product, its packaging, or the EU declaration of conformity, with identification number of notified body where applicable. For software products, CE marking on declaration or website
auditor_questions: Show me where the CE marking is affixed on this product or its accompanying documentation
For software products, where is the CE marking displayed?
Where a notified body was involved (Module H), is its identification number affixed alongside the CE marking?
How do you ensure correct application of the CE marking regime across all product variants?

maturity_levels.basic: CE marking correctly affixed on product, packaging, or declaration
maturity_levels.intermediate: CE marking process documented, notified body identification included where required, product labelling audited
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated CE marking verification in production, digital CE marking for software products linked to live declaration

description: Records demonstrating that importers verified the manufacturer performed conformity assessment, drew up technical documentation, product bears CE marking, and is accompanied by information and instructions to users as required by Annex II
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: How do you verify that the manufacturer has performed the required conformity assessment before placing the product on the market?
Show me evidence that you confirmed the product bears the CE marking and is accompanied by required documentation
How do you handle a product you believe is not in conformity with essential cybersecurity requirements?
Show me your storage and transport conditions and how they preserve product compliance

maturity_levels.basic: Basic checks performed before placing product on EU market
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured due diligence checklist, supplier qualification process, non-conformity escalation procedures
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated compliance verification system, real-time manufacturer conformity monitoring, integrated supply chain risk management

description: Information and instructions provided to users as set out in Annex II, in clear and understandable language, including secure installation and use instructions, support period end date, and single point of contact for vulnerability reporting
retention_period: 10 years after placing on the market or duration of support period, whichever is longer
auditor_questions: Show me the user information and instructions as required by Annex II
Is the support period end date clearly visible at the time of purchase and, where feasible, on the product itself?
How do you notify users when the product reaches end of support period?
Is the single point of contact for vulnerability reporting easily identifiable to users?

maturity_levels.basic: User instructions exist in understandable language with support period and contact information
maturity_levels.intermediate: Instructions available in all relevant languages, accessible online for 10+ years, end-of-support notifications implemented
maturity_levels.advanced: Dynamic digital instructions linked to product version, automated end-of-support alerts, user-friendly vulnerability reporting portal
